meanings.definition: A complete list of items such as property, goods in stock, or the contents of a building.
meanings.sent1: The store manager checked the inventories to see what products were running low.
meanings.sent2: At the end of the year, the company takes stock of its inventories to plan for the next fiscal period.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat knocked over the inventories of toys, causing a mess in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a vast library with inventories of memories neatly organized on shelves.
meanings.sent5: The detective meticulously examined the inventories of evidence to solve the case.

meanings.definition: The act or process of making an inventory.
meanings.sent1: The annual inventories of the warehouse were conducted to ensure accurate records.
meanings.sent2: Efficient inventories help businesses keep track of their assets and resources.
meanings.sent3: During the game of hide-and-seek, the children decided to play inventories to count all the players.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, a joyful sound like the music of inventories being taken.
meanings.sent5: The inventor's workshop was a place of constant inventories, with new ideas always being recorded.

meanings.definition: To make a complete list of items.
meanings.sent1: She inventories the supplies in the kitchen every month to ensure nothing is missing.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will inventory the books on the shelves to update the catalog.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to inventory the ingredients before starting to cook the meal.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to inventory every detail of the scene, capturing it for later use.
meanings.sent5: The explorer would inventory the treasures found during the expedition to document their discoveries.
